channel.title: SHiPS on PowerShell Magazine | For the most powerful community
channel.description: Recent content in SHiPS on PowerShell Magazine | For the most powerful community

item.title: #PSConfEU Agenda as a PowerShell Drive using #SHiPS
item.description: The SHiPS module has several use cases with structured data. I have written a few proof-of-concept modules using SHiPS to understand how it works and try out different design patterns.

item.title: Hyper-V Server PowerShell Drive based on #SHiPS
item.description: In an earlier article, I had written about a PowerShell provider for Failover Clusters written using the SHiPS provider framework. I have been experimenting with this a bit and made a few more providers.

item.title: Failover Cluster PowerShell Drive based on #SHiPS
item.description: Simple Hierarchy in PowerShell (SHiPS) is a module that simplifies implementing PowerShell providers. If you are new to PowerShell providers, a PowerShell provider allows any data store to be exposed like a file system as if it were a mounted drive.
